content: eiderdown shown in dimond laine downy fingering in color cambric eiderdown by jennifer evans for the lamb & kid a touch of lace a lot of stockinette stitch after stitch to relax into and enjoy this is both a process and a product knit perfect for a quiet season s project we know you ll love wearing your finished square too it s sized so that when you fold it on the diagonal you have ample tails to tuck into a coat or your best sweatshirt finished measurements approx 40 square wingspan is approx 62 when folded on the diagonal needles gauge needle us 7 4 5mm double points 16 32 and 40 circular needles or your preferred method for knitting small to large circumferences we used a 40 circular needle and worked using the magic loop technique until stitches fit around the needle optional a needle one-two sizes larger than your gauge needle for binding off notions eiderdown shown in dimond laine elmer tweed darning needle 4 markers including 1 unique marker for bor fingering in color thermal and dimond laine elmer fingering in color gray is my favorite color gauge approx 16 sts and 20 rounds = 4 in stockinette stitch in the round blocked while gauge is not critical for this project you will want a finished fabric with some drape and it may materials affect the finished size and the amount of yarn used dimond laine downy fingering 50% alpaca 34% cashmere 16% elastane 390 yards per 100g 3 skeins or dimond laine elmer fingering 80% merino 20% cashmere 400 yards per 100g and/or dimond laine elmer tweed fingering 70% merino 30% cashmere 400 yards per 100g abbreviations 3 skeins or bor beginning of round fingering-weight yarn in the following amount k knit 1150 yds / 1052m of each yarn k2tog knit 2 stitches together 1 st decrease d note if you choose to knit your border in a second color m marker you ll need approx 750 yards in the main color and 380 pm place marker yards in the border color rs right side ssk slip slip knit slip 2 stitches one at a time as if to one color sample shown in dimond laine downy fingering knit knit them together through back loops 1 st decrease d in color cambric st s stitch es two color sample shown in dimond laine elmer tweed fingering in color thermal 2 skeins with dimond laine elmer yo yarn over fingering in color gray is my favorite color 1 skein eiderdown version 1 // ©2024 the lamb & kid // all rights reserved for personal use only no portion of this pattern may be reproduced or distributed in any form or by any means without written permission pattern notes lace stripe round 9 k1 yo k to m yo repeat between brackets 3 more times this square is knit from the center out in the round you ll increase 8 sts every other round on either side
